articles.headline: Metal Thieves Are Stripping America’s Cities
articles.snippet: Across the country, copper and other valuable materials have been stolen from streetlights, statues and even gravesites, costing millions to repair.
articles.abstract: Across the country, copper and other valuable materials have been stolen from streetlights, statues and even gravesites, costing millions to repair.
articles.lead_paragraph: The 6th Street Bridge in Los Angeles is wired to glow with colorful lights celebrating the city’s spirit. But the bridge, known as the “Ribbon of Light,” goes dark at night now. So do stretches of the busy 405 freeway and dozens of street blocks across the city.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and Mark Abramson

articles.headline: Top Democrats, Swallowing Fears About Biden’s Candidacy, Remain Behind Him
articles.snippet: Lawmakers in the House and Senate met privately to hash out their concerns about President Biden’s viability, but leaders emerged from two separate meetings pledging allegiance to their candidate.
articles.abstract: Lawmakers in the House and Senate met privately to hash out their concerns about President Biden’s viability, but leaders emerged from two separate meetings pledging allegiance to their candidate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Top Democrats in Congress indicated on Tuesday that they were unwilling — at least for now — to mount an effort to push aside President Biden even after a day of meetings in which their members expressed grave concerns about his age, mental acuity and ability to win re-election.
articles.byline: By Catie Edmondson, Maya C. Miller, Robert Jimison and Annie Karni

articles.headline: U.S. and Allies Take Aim at Covert Russian Information Campaign
articles.snippet: Intelligence officials from three countries flagged a Russian influence campaign that used artificial intelligence to create nearly 1,000 fake accounts on the social media platform X.
articles.abstract: Intelligence officials from three countries flagged a Russian influence campaign that used artificial intelligence to create nearly 1,000 fake accounts on the social media platform X.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said on Tuesday that it had moved to disrupt a covert Russian influence operation that used artificial intelligence to spread propaganda in the United States, Europe and Israel with the goal of undermining support for Ukraine and stoking internal political divisions.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Julian E. Barnes

articles.headline: Britain Has Huge Clean Energy Ambitions, but Are They Realistic?
articles.snippet: Analysts warn that the Labour Party’s proposals are unlikely to be cheap and could come at the cost of jobs in the oil and gas industry.
articles.abstract: Analysts warn that the Labour Party’s proposals are unlikely to be cheap and could come at the cost of jobs in the oil and gas industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: There may be no better place to see evidence of Britain’s shift to cleaner energy than a sleek industrial complex on the Humber estuary outside Hull, a faded port city.

articles.headline: How a Distinctive Beauty Brand Fell Apart, Sinking Almost $700 Million With It
articles.snippet: When the private equity firm Carlyle bought Beautycounter, the skin care brand that people sold at kitchen tables, everything changed.
articles.abstract: When the private equity firm Carlyle bought Beautycounter, the skin care brand that people sold at kitchen tables, everything changed.
articles.lead_paragraph: Carlyle, the global private equity firm, has $425 billion in investor money powering companies that make aerospace equipment, wind turbines and airport terminals. But this year, when the firm experienced one of its biggest failures, it was on account of little bottles of cleansing scrubs and vitamin C serums sold in people’s living rooms.
articles.byline: By Jordyn Holman and Maureen Farrell

articles.headline: Amazon Says It Reached a Climate Goal Seven Years Early
articles.snippet: The company said it effectively got all of the electricity it used last year from sources that did not produce greenhouse gas emissions. Some experts have faulted the company’s calculations.
articles.abstract: The company said it effectively got all of the electricity it used last year from sources that did not produce greenhouse gas emissions. Some experts have faulted the company’s calculations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon announced on Wednesday that effectively all of the electricity its operations used last year came from sources that did not produce greenhouse gas emissions. But some experts have criticized the method the company uses to make that determination as being too lenient.
articles.byline: By Ivan Penn and Eli Tan

articles.headline: A Biden Confidant Emerges as a Crucial Mideast Diplomat
articles.snippet: Amos Hochstein, an energy policy official who was born in Israel, is playing diplomatic firefighter along the Israel-Lebanon border.
articles.abstract: Amos Hochstein, an energy policy official who was born in Israel, is playing diplomatic firefighter along the Israel-Lebanon border.
articles.lead_paragraph: A few weeks before Hamas attacked Israel on Oct. 7, a senior White House official visited eastern Lebanon for a sightseeing trip that doubled as a dramatic political statement.

articles.headline: A Late Play by the Biden Campaign: Running Out the Clock
articles.snippet: Time is on President Biden’s side. Every day that he defies pressure to end his re-election campaign, replacing him becomes harder for Democrats.
articles.abstract: Time is on President Biden’s side. Every day that he defies pressure to end his re-election campaign, replacing him becomes harder for Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden’s resistance to pressure to end his re-election bid appears to be a strategy aimed at running out the clock, a play to leave his party so little time to come up with another candidate that his opponents stand down.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Biden Announces Tariffs on Chinese Metals Routed Through Mexico
articles.snippet: The measure aims to close a loophole that officials said allowed metals made partly in China to come into the United States duty free.
articles.abstract: The measure aims to close a loophole that officials said allowed metals made partly in China to come into the United States duty free.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration took steps on Wednesday to prevent China from circumventing American tariffs on Chinese steel and aluminum by routing those imports through Mexico.

articles.headline: They Hit Their Health Care Deductible. It Was Time to Party.
articles.snippet: Some of those grappling with high health care costs are finding ways to celebrate small wins and build a sense of community.
articles.abstract: Some of those grappling with high health care costs are finding ways to celebrate small wins and build a sense of community.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last year, when CVS called Ian Goldstein and told him that he owed $23,000 for medicine he takes for Crohn’s disease, he spiraled in despair. After a fruitless call with the pharmacy, Mr. Goldstein, a comedian and writer who lives in Brooklyn, N.Y., went for a walk to clear his head and had to sit down.
